    "content": "# Investor Emails - Ready to Send
## Copy, Personalize, Send - Start Monday

**Goal:** Send 10 emails/day starting Monday for 5 days = 50 investors contacted

---

## How to Use This Document

1. **Copy email template**
2. **Personalize** [BRACKETS] with real info
3. **Send** via your email
4. **Track** in spreadsheet (at bottom)
5. **Follow up** after 1 week if no response

---

## Email 1-10: VR/AR Investors (Priority Tier 1)

### Email to Boost VC

**To:** team@boost.vc
**Subject:** VR Personal Data OS - Demo on Quest 3

```
Hi Boost VC team,

I'm building Hypernet - a personal data operating system with a VR interface on Meta Quest 3. Think "iOS for your personal data, but in VR."

The problem: Your digital life is scattered across 50+ apps. You have no control, and AI companies train on your data without paying you.

Our solution:
• Unified data layer (every object gets a Hypernet Address)
• Immersive VR interface (see your life in 3D on Quest 3)
• AI marketplace (users get paid when AI companies access their data)

We have a working demo. I'd love to put you in the headset for 15 minutes - it's the best way to understand what we're building.

Raising $500K seed to scale to 100K users in 12 months. Given your focus on VR, I thought this might be up your alley.

Available for a call this week?

Best,
[Your Name]
[Your Title]
[Your Email]
[Your Phone]

P.S. - Quick deck: [Link when you have it]
```

---

### Email to The VR Fund

**To:** [Find on their website - thevr.fund]
**Subject:** Personal OS in VR - Quest 3 Demo Available

```
Hi [Name],

Quick question: What if you could see your entire digital life in VR?

I'm building Hypernet - essentially a personal operating system where the interface is virtual reality. Working demo on Quest 3.

Key insight: VR needs compelling use cases beyond games and social. We're building the productivity layer - unified access to all your personal data (photos, emails, documents, calendar) with AI assistance built in.

Early signals are strong:
• Complete architecture designed (260K+ words documented)
• Working prototype (Quest 3, connects to real data)
• 4 revenue streams (subscription, AI marketplace, enterprise, platform fees)

Raising $500K. Would love to show you the demo if you're interested in VR productivity apps.

15-min call?

[Your Name]
[Contact info]
```

---

### Email to Former Oculus Exec (e.g., Brendan Iribe)

**To:** [Find on LinkedIn]
**Subject:** Building the missing layer for consumer VR

```
Hi [Name],

I've been following your work since the Oculus days. I'm building something I think you'd find interesting.

Hypernet: Personal data OS in VR. The thesis is that VR needs a killer app beyond gaming, and "see your entire digital life in 3D" could be it.

The product:
• Import all your data (photos, emails, calendar, documents)
• Navigate it spatially in Quest 3
• AI assistant with full context
• Users own and control everything

The business:
• Consumer subscription ($10/mo)
• AI companies pay users for data access
• Enterprise data management
• Developer platform

Raising $500K seed. Given your experience building the VR industry, I'd love your feedback. Any chance you'd be open to a 20-min call?

Best,
[Your Name]

Demo video: [Link]
```

---

## Email 11-20: Consumer/Data Investors (Priority Tier 2)

### Email to Union Square Ventures

**To:** [Find on USV website - usv.com]
**Subject:** User-owned data network in VR

```
Hi [Name],

I'm building Hypernet, and I think it aligns perfectly with USV's thesis on user-owned data networks.

The problem: Your data is fragmented (50+ apps), controlled by Big Tech, and AI companies profit from it without compensating you.

Our solution: Unified personal data layer where:
1. You own and control everything
2. AI companies pay YOU for access ($5-50/month passive income)
3. VR interface makes it magical (Quest 3)

This creates a network effect: More users → more data → better AI context → more users want in.

We have a working Quest 3 demo. Raising $500K seed to get to 100K users and $2M ARR in 12 months.

Given USV's focus on user ownership and data networks, I'd love to show you what we're building. 20-min call?

[Your Name]
[Contact info]
```

---

### Email to Initialized Capital

**To:** [Find on initialized.com]
**Subject:** VR + Personal Data = $2T Market

```
Hi [Name],

Quick pitch: We're building Hypernet - think Notion meets Google Photos meets Bloomberg Terminal, but in VR.

The insight: Everyone wants unified personal data, but 2D interfaces suck for it. VR makes it intuitive and beautiful.

Working demo:
• Put on Quest 3
• See your photos, emails, calendar in immersive 3D
• Ask AI: "Show me photos from our vacation last summer"
• It instantly shows them, plus the emails about planning it, plus the calendar events

Traction:
• Complete architecture (fully documented)
• Working prototype (Quest 3)
• Clear path to 4 revenue streams

Raising $500K. Would love 15 minutes to show you the demo.

Available this week?

[Your Name]
```

---

### Email to Homebrew

**To:** [Find on homebrew.co]
**Subject:** Finally, a VR app normies will actually use

```
Hi [Name],

Most VR apps are games or social. We're building the productivity layer: Hypernet, a personal data OS in VR.

Why it works:
• Everyone has this problem (data fragmentation)
• VR makes it delightful (not just functional)
• Users get paid (AI companies access data, users earn passive income)

Why now:
• Quest 3 = $500, great quality, millions sold
• AI boom = desperate need for personal context data
• Privacy regs = users want control

We have a working Quest 3 demo. It's pretty magical.

Raising $500K to get to 100K users. Given Homebrew's focus on consumer and data, thought you might be interested.

Coffee this week?

[Your Name]
```

---

## Email 21-30: Angels & Micro VCs

### Email to Naval Ravikant

**To:** [Find on Twitter, DM or email if you can find it]
**Subject:** Users finally owning their data (+ earning from it)

```
Hi Naval,

You've written about users needing to own their data. I'm building the practical implementation: Hypernet.

The pitch:
• Unified personal data layer (everything has a Hypernet Address)
• VR interface (Quest 3) for navigation
• AI marketplace: Companies pay users $5-50/mo for data access

This flips the script: Instead of users being the product, users GET PAID.

Early prototype is working. Raising $500K to scale.

I know your time is limited, but if you're interested in user data ownership, I'd love 15 minutes to show you the demo.

Worth a look?

[Your Name]
```

---

### Email to Balaji Srinivasan

**To:** [Twitter DM or email]
**Subject:** Data sovereignty in VR

```
Balaji,

Big fan of your work on data sovereignty. Building Hypernet - a personal data OS where users control everything and AI companies pay for access.

Key principles:
• User ownership (data stored locally or user's cloud choice)
• Cryptographic addressing (every object gets a Hypernet Address)
• AI access marketplace (transparent, user-controlled, compensated)
• VR interface (Quest 3) as the native UI

This is the sovereignty stack you've talked about, implemented practically.

Working demo available. Raising $500K seed.

Any interest in a quick call?

[Your Name]
```

---

## Email 31-40: Generalist Seed Funds

### Email Template (Customize per fund)

**To:** [Find specific partner on fund website]
**Subject:** [Personal hook based on their portfolio] + VR Personal OS

```
Hi [Name],

I noticed [FUND NAME] invested in [THEIR PORTFOLIO COMPANY]. I'm building something in a related space: Hypernet, a personal data OS in VR.

Quick summary:
• Problem: Digital life scattered across 50+ apps
• Solution: Unified layer with VR interface (Quest 3)
• Differentiation: Users get paid when AI companies access their data
• Traction: Working prototype, complete architecture

We're raising $500K to get to 100K users and $2M ARR in 12 months.

The demo is impressive - best experienced in person (I can bring the Quest 3 to you).

Would love 20 minutes of your time this week or next.

[Your Name]
[Contact info]

One-pager: [Link]
```

---

## Email 41-50: Y Combinator Application Email

### Email to YC Partners (After Applying)

**To:** [YC partners you can find]
**Subject:** YC S24 Applicant - Hypernet (VR Personal Data OS)

```
Hi [Partner Name],

We just submitted our YC S24 application (Hypernet - personal data OS in VR).

Quick version:
• We're building Notion + Google Photos + VR, where users get paid when AI companies access their data
• Working Quest 3 demo (uncommon for YC applicants)
• Founder: [Your background - technical, shipped products, etc.]

Three reasons this is a YC company:
1. Technical depth (complete architecture, working code)
2. Market timing (VR ready, AI needs data, regs support users)
3. Clear path to scale (4 revenue streams, network effects)

Would love to demo for you if you're open to it. Can bring Quest 3 to YC office.

Application ID: [Your YC app ID]

Best,
[Your Name]
[Contact]
```
